TITLE: Using Basic stringr Functions in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic string manipulation functions in stringr, including str_length() to get string length, str_c() to concatenate strings, and str_sub() to extract substrings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
x <- c("why", "video", "cross", "extra", "deal", "authority")
str_length(x) 
#> [1] 3 5 5 5 4 9
str_c(x, collapse = ", ")
#> [1] "why, video, cross, extra, deal, authority"
str_sub(x, 1, 2)
#> [1] "wh" "vi" "cr" "ex" "de" "au"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using stringr with Pipes in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using stringr functions with the pipe operator (%>%) from the magrittr package, showing how to chain multiple string operations together for more complex text processing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
letters %>%
  .[1:10] %>% 
  str_pad(3, "right") %>%
  str_c(letters[2:11])
#>  [1] "a  b" "b  c" "c  d" "d  e" "e  f" "f  g" "g  h" "h  i" "i  j" "j  k"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Working with Regular Expressions in stringr
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use regular expressions with stringr functions to find vowels in strings, including str_subset() to extract matching elements and str_count() to count matches.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_subset(x, "[aeiou]")
#> [1] "video"     "cross"     "extra"     "deal"      "authority"
str_count(x, "[aeiou]")
#> [1] 0 3 1 2 2 4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting Pattern Matches with str_extract() in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using str_extract() to extract the actual text that matches a pattern. The example extracts the first vowel from each string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_extract(x, "[aeiou]")
#> [1] NA  "i" "o" "e" "e" "a"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using str_detect() for Pattern Matching in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the str_detect() function which checks if strings contain a pattern, returning a logical vector. The example shows detecting vowels in strings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_detect(x, "[aeiou]")
#> [1] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Replacing Pattern Matches with str_replace() in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using str_replace() to substitute patterns with replacement text. The example replaces the first vowel in each string with a question mark.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_replace(x, "[aeiou]", "?")
#> [1] "why"       "v?deo"     "cr?ss"     "?xtra"     "d?al"      "?uthority"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Finding Pattern Positions with str_locate() in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use str_locate() to identify the position of pattern matches within strings. The example finds the position of the first vowel in each string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_locate(x, "[aeiou]")
#>      start end
#> [1,]    NA  NA
#> [2,]     2   2
#> [3,]     3   3
#> [4,]     1   1
#> [5,]     2   2
#> [6,]     1   1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Counting Pattern Matches with str_count() in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use str_count() to count the number of times a pattern appears in strings. The example counts vowels in each string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_count(x, "[aeiou]")
#> [1] 0 3 1 2 2 4
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Splitting Strings with str_split() in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use str_split() to break strings into multiple pieces based on a delimiter. The example splits strings at commas.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_split(c("a,b", "c,d,e"), ",")
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "a" "b"
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "c" "d" "e"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing stringr in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to install stringr either as part of the tidyverse collection or as a standalone package using the install.packages() function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# The easiest way to get stringr is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just stringr:
install.packages("stringr")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Capturing Groups with str_match() in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use str_match() to extract parts of matches defined by parentheses in regular expressions. The example extracts characters surrounding vowels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# extract the characters on either side of the vowel
str_match(x, "(.)[aeiou](.)")
#>      [,1]  [,2] [,3]
#> [1,] NA    NA   NA  
#> [2,] "vid" "v"  "d" 
#> [3,] "ros" "r"  "s" 
#> [4,] NA    NA   NA  
#> [5,] "dea" "d"  "a" 
#> [6,] "aut" "a"  "t"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using str_like() in R
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the SQL LIKE operator functionality in R's stringr package. This demonstrates the case-sensitive pattern matching behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_like("text", pattern = "%ex%") # matches containing 'ex'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting Matching Strings with str_subset() in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using str_subset() to extract elements from a vector that match a pattern. The example extracts strings containing vowels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_subset(x, "[aeiou]")
#> [1] "video"     "cross"     "extra"     "deal"      "authority"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using str_dup() with separator in R
DESCRIPTION: Example of using str_dup() function with a separator to repeat strings with a delimiter between repeated values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_dup("abc", times = 3, sep = ",") # returns "abc,abc,abc"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating Multiple Pattern Replacements in R using str_replace_all
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use str_replace_all() to apply multiple pairs of pattern and replacement to the same vector in R. It demonstrates a convenient syntax for replacing multiple patterns in a single function call.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
input <- c("abc", "def")
str_replace_all(input, c("[ad]" = "!", "[cf]" = "?"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: String Extraction with str_split_1() in R
DESCRIPTION: Using str_split_1() for splitting a single string into multiple pieces. Designed specifically for single string input cases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_split_1("a,b,c", ",") # returns c("a", "b", "c")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: String Flattening with str_flatten_comma() in R
DESCRIPTION: Using str_flatten_comma() to combine strings with proper comma separation and Oxford comma support.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_flatten_comma(c("a", "b", "c")) # returns "a, b, and c"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing RegExplain Addin for RStudio
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to install the RegExplain RStudio addin using devtools, which provides a friendly interface for working with regular expressions and stringr functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("gadenbuie/regexplain")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_split_fixed() Input Validation in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests str_split_fixed() function for proper error handling when an invalid value is provided for the 'n' parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/split.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_split_fixed("x", "x", 0)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_split_i() Input Validation in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests str_split_i() function for proper error handling when invalid values are provided for the 'i' parameter, including zero and non-integer values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/split.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_split_i("x", "x", 0)
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_split_i("x", "x", 0.5)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Empty Pattern Validation in stringr Functions
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates error handling when empty string patterns are provided to str_detect, str_starts, and str_ends functions. Empty patterns are not allowed and result in errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/detect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_detect("x", "")
str_starts("x", "")
str_ends("x", "")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: str_like Pattern Type Validation
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates that str_like function only accepts plain strings as patterns, not regex patterns or other stringr modifiers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/detect.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_like("abc", regex("x"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Matching Across Lines with str_view in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates str_view's ability to match patterns across multiple lines in a string using regex patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/view.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view("a\nb\nbbb\nc", "(b|\n)+")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Highlighting Pattern Matches with str_view in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how str_view highlights all matches of a pattern within strings. The first example shows vowel matches and the second shows matches of either 'd' or 'e'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/view.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(x, "[aeiou]")
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(x, "d|e")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Recycling Rules in str_c()
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates error handling when attempting to recycle vectors of incompatible sizes in str_c(). Shows that attempting to recycle a size 2 vector with a size 0 vector throws an appropriate error.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/c.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_c(c("x", "y"), character())
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Vectorized Arguments Validation in str_c()
DESCRIPTION: Verifies that str_c() properly validates sep and collapse parameters to ensure they are single strings. Shows error handling when attempting to use character vectors for these parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/c.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_c(letters, sep = c("a", "b"))
str_c(letters, collapse = c("a", "b"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_conv() with Multiple Encodings in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the str_conv() function from the stringr package by passing multiple encodings as an argument. It expects the function to raise an error indicating that the encoding argument must be a single string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/conv.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
str_conv("A", c("ISO-8859-1", "ISO-8859-2"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_dup() with multiple strings as separator in R
DESCRIPTION: This code tests the error handling of str_dup() when a character vector with multiple strings is provided for the 'sep' parameter. The function should raise an error indicating that 'sep' must be a single string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/dup.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_dup("a", 3, sep = c("-", ";"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Format Specifiers with Nested Placeholders
DESCRIPTION: Shows error handling when combining format specifiers with nested placeholders in str_interp.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/interp.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_interp("$[.2f]{${msg}}")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Strings with str_view in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic usage of str_view to display strings from the 'words' vector. When the output is large, it's automatically truncated with an indication of how many more items exist.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/view.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(words)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Non-Character Input Validation in str_interp
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates input validation when passing non-character input (integer) to str_interp.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/interp.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_interp(3L)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_match_all with collation pattern
DESCRIPTION: Shows error handling when using coll() pattern modifier with str_match_all function instead of a regular expression
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/match.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_match_all(phones, coll("9"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_match with collation pattern on simple string
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates error handling when using coll() pattern modifier with str_match function on a simple string input
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/match.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_match("x", coll("y"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Whitespace Characters with str_view in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows how str_view displays whitespace characters either with special formatting or using escape sequences when use_escapes=TRUE is specified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/view.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(x)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# or can instead use escapes
str_view(x, use_escapes = TRUE)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pattern Coercion Tests in R
DESCRIPTION: Tests demonstrating warning messages when patterns are coerced to character vectors using regex(), coll(), and fixed() functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/modifiers.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
. <- regex(x)
. <- coll(x)
. <- fixed(x)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Type Error Testing in R
DESCRIPTION: Test case showing error message when attempting to use incorrect data type (integer vector) as pattern input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/modifiers.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
type(1:3)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Error When Using Non-String Replacement in str_replace in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the error thrown when attempting to use a numeric value (1) instead of a string for the replacement parameter in the str_replace function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/replace.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_replace("x", "x", 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Function Vectorization Error in str_replace_all in R
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates the error when a replacement function in str_replace_all doesn't properly handle vectorization. The function must accept character vectors of any length.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/replace.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_replace_all(x, "a|c", ~ if (length(x) > 1) stop("Bad"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_trunc() Error Handling with Default Ellipsis in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates an error condition in stringr's str_trunc() function when the requested width (2) is shorter than the default ellipsis length (3). The function correctly produces an error message explaining the issue.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/trunc.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_trunc("foobar", 2)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing str_trunc() Error Handling with Custom Ellipsis in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates an error condition in stringr's str_trunc() function when the requested width (3) is shorter than a custom ellipsis length (4). The function correctly produces an error message explaining the issue.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/trunc.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_trunc("foobar", 3, ellipsis = "....")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Return Type and Length Errors in Replacement Functions in R
DESCRIPTION: These snippets show errors when replacement functions return incorrect types or lengths. Replacement functions must return character vectors of the same length as the input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/replace.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_replace_all("x", "x", ~1)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_replace_all("x", "x", ~ c("a", "b"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Deprecated str_view_all Function in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows the deprecated str_view_all function with a warning message recommending to use str_view instead.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/view.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view_all("abc", "a|b")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: HTML Output Mode in str_view for R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the HTML output mode of str_view which generates HTML markup for visualization in web contexts. Shows both regular matching and with escape sequences enabled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/view.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(x, "[aeiou]", html = TRUE)$x$html
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(x, "d|e", html = TRUE)$x$html
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(x, html = TRUE, use_escapes = TRUE)$x$html
```

TITLE: Using str_view with Match Parameter in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows how str_view preserves original vector indices when displaying only matching elements. The match=TRUE parameter filters the output to show only strings that match the pattern.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/view.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_view(letters, "a|z", match = TRUE)
```

TITLE: Testing str_split() Input Validation in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests str_split() function for proper error handling with mismatched vector sizes, incorrect data types, and invalid parameter values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/split.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

```
str_split(letters[1:3], letters[1:2])
```

CODE:
```
str_split("x", 1)
```

CODE:
```
str_split("x", "x", n = 0)
```

TITLE: Testing Error Handling in str_sub Function with Incompatible Vector Sizes in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how str_sub() produces informative error messages when trying to recycle vectors of incompatible lengths. The first example shows an error when extracting substrings with mismatched vector lengths, and the second shows an error when assigning to substrings with mismatched lengths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/stringr/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/sub.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_sub(x, 1:2, 1:3)
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
str_sub(x, 1:2, 1:2) <- 1:3
```
